reflexive.name: multitex overlay
reflexive.comment: where you want the origin of the texture. *"texture" uses the texture coordinates supplied *"screen" uses the origin of the screen as the origin of the texture
how to blend the textures together
how much to scale the textures
how much to offset the origin of the texture

reflexive.name: effectors
reflexive.comment: These describe the relationship that causes the effect. * destination type is the type of variable you want to be effected * destination tells which texture map (or geometry offset) to apply it to * source says which value to look at when computing the effect
When the source is at the lower inbound, the destination ends up the lower outbound and vice-versa applies for the upper values.
If destination is tint, these values are used instead of the out bounds.
If you use a periodic function as the source, this lets you tweak it.

bit.name: interpolate between min/max flash colors as state changes

int16.name: value scale
int16.description: used for non-integral values, i.e. health and shields

plugin.comment:
Crosshairs always go in the center of the screen. Crosshairs can be attached to one of four different states:
* Aim: Default crosshair. Frame 0 is the default state, frame 1 is the auto-aim state (frame rate ignored) * Zoom: Zoom overlay. Each zoom level has a corresponding frame (frame rate ignored) * Charge: Charging overlay. If you wish to display an animation for charging, put it here. * Flash: Similar to charging, but for low ammo/batter/heat states * Reload/Overheat: Similar to charging, but for reloading/overheating

option.name: flash when firing and no ammo
flash when throwing and no grenade
low ammo and none left to reload
flash when firing secondary trigger with no ammo
low secondary ammo and none left to reload
flash when firing with depleted battery

reflexive.name: screen effect
reflexive.comment: Mask bitmap overlay. Use either a 2D bitmap or an interface bitmap.
Warp effect like in 'Pitch-Black', sort of.
Real-time gamma correction to make dark objects appear brighter.

int16.name: sequence index
int16.description: sequence index into the global hud icon bitmap

int16.name: width offset
int16.description: extra spacing beyond bitmap width for text alignment

bit.name: width offset is absolute icon width
